/data/reddylab/Kuei/repo/Proj_ENCODE_FCC/scripts/config_project.sh


RUN


Code
### init: set executable
FN_EXE="run_bedtools_coverage.sh"
FP_EXE=${FD_EXE}/${FN_EXE}

### Execute
while read FOLDER_A FNAME_A LABEL_A FPATH_A; do
    
    ### set input file
    FD_INP_A=$(dirname ${FPATH_A})
    FN_INP_A=${FNAME_A}
    FP_INP_A=${FPATH_A}
    
    ### loop through each assay
    for ASSAY_NAME in ${ASSAY_NAMES[@]}; do

        ### Set directory
        FD_INP_B=${FD_RES}/${ASSAY_TYPE}/${ASSAY_NAME}/fragment_counts
        FP_INPS=($(ls ${FD_INP_B}/*hg38*rep*bed.gz))
        #FP_INPS=($(ls ${FD_INP_B}/*hg38*rep1*bed.gz))

        ### loop through each sample
        for FP_INP_B in ${FP_INPS[@]}; do
        
            ### set input file
            FD_INP_B=$(dirname  ${FP_INP_B})
            FN_INP_B=$(basename ${FP_INP_B})
            
            ### setup output file
            FD_OUT=${FD_RES}/region_coverage_fcc_score/${LABEL_A}/${ASSAY_NAME}
            FN_OUT=${FN_INP_B}
            FP_OUT=${FD_OUT}/${FN_OUT}
            
            ### setup log file
            FN_LOG=region.coverage.${LABEL_A}.${ASSAY_NAME}.${FN_OUT}.txt
            FP_LOG=${FD_LOG}/${FN_LOG}
            
            ### show progress
            echo ==============================
            echo "Region folder:" ${FOLDER_A}
            echo "Region label: " ${LABEL_A}
            echo "Assay  name:  " ${ASSAY_NAME}
            echo
            echo "Input fdiry:  " ${FD_INP_A/${FD_RES}/'${FD_RES}'}
            echo "Input fname:  " ${FN_INP_A}
            echo "Input fdiry:  " ${FD_INP_B/${FD_RES}/'${FD_RES}'}
            echo "Input fname:  " ${FN_INP_B}
            echo
            echo "Output fdiry: " ${FD_OUT/${FD_RES}/'${FD_RES}'}
            echo "Output fname: " ${FN_OUT}
            echo
            echo "Log file:" '${FD_LOG}/'${FN_LOG}
            echo

            ### execute
            mkdir -p ${FD_OUT}
            sbatch \
                --cpus-per-task 4 \
                --mem 10G \
                --output ${FP_LOG} \
                ${FP_EXE} ${FP_CNF} ${FP_INP_A} ${FP_INP_B} ${FP_OUT}
            echo
        done
    done
#done < <(cat ${FP_REGION_LABEL} | awk 'NR >=2 {print}' | head -n 1)    
done < <(cat ${FP_REGION_LABEL} | awk 'NR >=2 {print}')

/data/reddylab/Kuei/repo/Proj_ENCODE_FCC/scripts/config_project.sh


RUN


Code
### init: set executable
FN_EXE="run_bedtools_intersect.sh"
FP_EXE=${FD_EXE}/${FN_EXE}

### Execute
while read FOLDER_A FNAME_A LABEL_A FPATH_A; do
    
    ### set input file
    FD_INP_A=$(dirname ${FPATH_A})
    FN_INP_A=${FNAME_A}
    FP_INP_A=${FPATH_A}
    
    ### loop through each assay
    for ASSAY_NAME in ${ASSAY_NAMES[@]}; do

        ### Set input file
        FD_INP=${FD_RES}/${ASSAY_TYPE}/${ASSAY_NAME}/coverage
        FP_INPS=($(ls ${FD_INP}/*hg38*bed.gz))
        #FP_INPS=($(ls ${FD_INP}/*hg38*ZScore*bed.gz))
    
        ### loop through each sample
        for FP_INP_B in ${FP_INPS[@]}; do
        
            ### set input file
            FD_INP_B=$(dirname  ${FP_INP_B})
            FN_INP_B=$(basename ${FP_INP_B})
            
            ### setup output file
            FD_OUT=${FD_RES}/region_coverage_fcc_score/${LABEL_A}/${ASSAY_NAME}
            FN_OUT=${FN_INP_B}
            FP_OUT=${FD_OUT}/${FN_OUT}
            
            ### setup log file
            FN_LOG=region.coverage.${LABEL_A}.${ASSAY_NAME}.${FN_OUT}.txt
            FP_LOG=${FD_LOG}/${FN_LOG}
            
            ### show progress
            echo ==============================
            echo "Region folder:" ${FOLDER_A}
            echo "Region label: " ${LABEL_A}
            echo "Assay  name:  " ${ASSAY_NAME}
            echo
            echo "Input fdiry:  " ${FD_INP_A/${FD_RES}/'${FD_RES}'}
            echo "Input fname:  " ${FN_INP_A}
            echo "Input fdiry:  " ${FD_INP_B/${FD_RES}/'${FD_RES}'}
            echo "Input fname:  " ${FN_INP_B}
            echo
            echo "Output fdiry: " ${FD_OUT/${FD_RES}/'${FD_RES}'}
            echo "Output fname: " ${FN_OUT}
            echo
            echo "Log file:" '${FD_LOG}/'${FN_LOG}
            echo
            
            ### execute
            mkdir -p ${FD_OUT}
            sbatch \
                --cpus-per-task 4 \
                --mem 10G \
                --output ${FP_LOG} \
                ${FP_EXE} ${FP_CNF} ${FP_INP_A} ${FP_INP_B} ${FP_OUT}
            echo
        done
    done
#done < <(cat ${FP_REGION_LABEL} | awk 'NR >=2 {print}' | head -n 1)    
done < <(cat ${FP_REGION_LABEL} | awk 'NR >=2 {print}')

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 12
section: Loop through regions and assays to create count matrix
text:
Loop through regions and assays to create count matrix
Test loop


Code
### init: region folders
dat = dat_meta_region
vec = dat$Label
vec_txt_region = vec

### init: assay
txt_assay      = "MPRA_Tiling_K562_Tewhey_Hannah"
vec_txt_prefix = c("OL13", "OL43", "OL45")
vec_txt_type   = c("raw", "norm")

### execute
for (txt_region_label in vec_txt_region[1]) {

    ### set directory for region description
    txt_region_folder = lst_txt_region[[txt_region_label]]
    txt_fdiry = file.path(FD_RES, "region", txt_region_folder, "summary")
    txt_fname = "description.tsv"
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

    ### get region description and set column names/types
    dat = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
    vec = dat$Name
    vec_txt_cname = c(vec, "Count")
    vec_col_ctype = cols(Count = col_character())
    
    ### loop through each assay under each region
    for (txt_prefix in vec_txt_prefix) {
        for (txt_type in vec_txt_type) {
            ### set directory for assay metadata
            txt_fdiry = file.path(FD_RES, "assay_fcc", txt_assay, "fragment_counts", "summary")
            txt_fname = "metadata.tsv"
            txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        
            ### read metadata and setup sample names
            dat  = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
            vec1 = dat$FName
            vec2 = dat$Sample
            dat_meta_assay = dat
            vec_txt_sample = setNames(vec1, vec2)
            
            ### set directory for assay counts
            txt_fdiry = file.path(
                FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score",
                txt_region_label,
                txt_assay
            )
            txt_fname = paste("", txt_prefix, "hg38", txt_type, "bed.gz", sep = "*")
            txt_fglob = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

            ### get count files
            vec_txt_fpath = Sys.glob(txt_fglob)
            vec_txt_fname = basename(vec_txt_fpath)

            ### show progress:
            cat("\n====================\n")
            cat("Region Folder:", txt_region_folder, "\n")
            cat("Region Label: ", txt_region_label,  "\n")
            cat("Assay  Folder:", txt_assay,         "\n")
            cat("Import Counts:\n")
            print(vec_txt_fname)
            cat("\n")
            flush.console()
        }
    }
}

Define helper function


Code
fun = function(dat1, dat2){
    dat = dplyr::full_join(dat1, dat2, by = c("Chrom", "ChromStart", "ChromEnd", "Region"))
    return(dat)
}


Generate count matrix for each region set for each assay


Code
### init: region folders
dat = dat_meta_region
vec = dat$Label
vec_txt_region = vec

### init: assay
txt_assay      = "MPRA_Tiling_K562_Tewhey_Hannah"
vec_txt_prefix = c("OL13", "OL43", "OL45")
vec_txt_type   = c("raw", "norm")

### loop through each region folder
for (txt_region_label in vec_txt_region) {
    
    ### set directory for region description
    txt_region_folder = lst_txt_region[[txt_region_label]]
    txt_fdiry = file.path(FD_RES, "region", txt_region_folder, "summary")
    txt_fname = "description.tsv"
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

    ### get region description and set column names/types
    dat = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
    vec = dat$Name
    vec_txt_cname = c(vec, "Count")
    vec_col_ctype = cols(Count = col_character())
        
    ### loop through each assay under each region
    for (txt_prefix in vec_txt_prefix) {
        for (txt_type in vec_txt_type) {
            
            ### set directory for assay metadata
            txt_fdiry = file.path(FD_RES, "assay_fcc", txt_assay, "fragment_counts", "summary")
            txt_fname = "metadata.tsv"
            txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        
            ### read metadata and setup sample names
            dat  = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
            vec1 = dat$FName
            vec2 = dat$Sample
            dat_meta_assay = dat
            vec_txt_sample = setNames(vec1, vec2)
            
            ### set directory for assay counts
            txt_fdiry = file.path(
                FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score",
                txt_region_label,
                txt_assay
            )
            txt_fname = paste("", txt_prefix, "hg38", txt_type, "bed.gz", sep = "*")
            txt_fglob = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

            ### get count files
            vec_txt_fpath = Sys.glob(txt_fglob)
            vec_txt_fname = basename(vec_txt_fpath)

            ### show progress:
            cat("\n====================\n")
            cat("Region Folder:", txt_region_folder, "\n")
            cat("Region Label: ", txt_region_label,  "\n")
            cat("Assay  Folder:", txt_assay,         "\n")
            cat("Import Counts:\n")
            print(vec_txt_fname)
            cat("\n")
            flush.console()

            ### loop through count files and import them
            lst_dat = lapply(vec_txt_fpath, function(txt_fpath){

                ### read table
                dat = read_tsv(
                    txt_fpath, 
                    col_names = vec_txt_cname, 
                    col_types = vec_col_ctype, 
                    show_col_types = FALSE)
    
                ### arrange the columns
                dat = dat %>% 
                    dplyr::select(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Count) %>%
                    dplyr::mutate(Region = paste0(Chrom, ":", ChromStart, "-", ChromEnd)) %>%
                    dplyr::mutate(Count  = replace(Count, Count == ".", "0")) %>%
                    dplyr::mutate(Count  = as.integer(Count)) %>%
                    dplyr::select(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Region, Count) %>%
                    dplyr::distinct()
    
                ### rename column to include the file name
                txt_fname = basename(txt_fpath)
                vec = c("Chrom", "ChromStart", "ChromEnd", "Region", txt_fname)
                colnames(dat) = vec
                
                return(dat)
            })
            
            ### combine imported counts into a matrix
            dat_cnt = Reduce(fun, lst_dat)
            dat_cnt = dplyr::rename(dat_cnt, any_of(vec_txt_sample))
            
            ### filter out unaligned reigons
            mat_cnt = dat_cnt %>%
                dplyr::select(-Chrom, -ChromStart, -ChromEnd) %>%
                column_to_rownames(var = "Region")
            vec  = apply(mat_cnt, 1, sum)
            idx1 = (vec != 0)
            
            ### re-order columns: Input ---> Output
            vec  = colnames(mat_cnt)
            vec  = sort(vec)
            idx2 = c("Chrom", "ChromStart", "ChromEnd", "Region", vec)
            
            ### get the final count matrix
            dat_cnt = dat_cnt[idx1,idx2]
    
            ### combine count matrix and column data
            dat_col = dat_meta_assay %>% dplyr::filter(FName %in% vec_txt_fname)
            lst_dat = list(
                "data_cnt" = dat_cnt,
                "data_col" = dat_col
            )

            ### show progress
            cat("Removing zero:", "\n")
            cat("Before removing zero:", nrow(mat_cnt), "\n")
            cat("After  removing zero:", nrow(dat_cnt), "\n")
            cat("\n")
            flush.console()

            ### show progress
            cat("Save count matrix and data list.\n")
            flush.console()
            
            ### set directory for saving results
            txt_fdiry = file.path(
                FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score",
                txt_region_label,
                txt_assay,
                "summary"
            )
            txt_cmd = paste("mkdir -p", txt_fdiry)
            system(txt_cmd)
    
            ### save count matrix
            ###     matrix.count.raw.OL13.tsv
            ###     matrix.count.raw.OL43.tsv
            ###     matrix.count.raw.OL45.tsv
            #txt_fname = "matrix.raw.count.WGS.tsv"
            txt_fname = paste("matrix", "count", txt_type, txt_prefix, "tsv", sep = ".")
            txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
            cat(txt_fname, "\n")
            flush.console()
            
            dat = dat_cnt
            write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
    
            ### save data list
            ###     data_list.count_column.raw.OL13.tsv
            ###     data_list.count_column.raw.OL43.tsv
            #txt_fname = "data_list_count_column.rds"
            txt_fname = paste("data", "count_column", txt_type, txt_prefix, "rds", sep = ".")
            txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
            cat(txt_fname, "\n")
            flush.console()
            
            obj = lst_dat
            saveRDS(obj, txt_fpath)
    
            ### show progress: matrix
            cat("\n")
            cat("First few rows of the matrix:", "\n")
            flush.console()
            fun_display_table(head(dat_cnt, 3))
            
            cat("Last few rows of the matrix:", "\n")
            flush.console()
            fun_display_table(tail(dat_cnt, 3))
            cat("\n")
            flush.console()
        }
    }
}

Apply EdgeR filtering and DESeq2 model fitting


Code
### init: assay prefix and helper function
vec_txt_prefix = c("OL13", "OL43", "OL45")
fun_get_prefix = function(txt){
    res = fun_str_map_detect(txt, vec_txt_prefix, vec_txt_prefix)
    return(res)
}

### loop through each region set
for (txt_region in VEC_TXT_REGION) {

    ### init: get RDS files w/ count matrix and column information
    txt_fdiry = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region, TXT_ASSAY, "summary")
    txt_fname = "data*count_column*raw*rds"
    txt_fglob = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    
    ### get files and show progress
    vec = Sys.glob(txt_fglob)
    vec_txt_fpath_inp = vec
    for (txt in vec) {cat(txt, "\n")}
    cat("\n")
    flush.console()
    
    ### loop through each file
    for (txt_fpath_inp in vec_txt_fpath_inp){

        ### read object
        lst_dat = readRDS(txt_fpath_inp)
        dat_cnt = lst_dat$data_cnt
        dat_col = lst_dat$data_col
        
        ### arrange column data
        dat_col = dat_col  %>% 
            dplyr::mutate(Group = factor(Group, levels = c("Input", "Output"))) %>%
            column_to_rownames(var = "Sample")
        
        ### arrange count matrix
        mat_tot = dat_cnt %>%
            dplyr::select(-Chrom, -ChromStart, -ChromEnd) %>%
            column_to_rownames(var = "Region")
        mat_inp = mat_tot %>% dplyr::select(starts_with("Input"))
        mat_out = mat_tot %>% dplyr::select(starts_with("Output"))

        ### create list of DGE objects for total, input, and output
        lst = list()
        lst[["Total"]]  = DGEList(counts=mat_tot, group = dat_col$Group)
        lst[["Input"]]  = DGEList(counts=mat_inp, group = rep("Input",  ncol(mat_inp)))
        lst[["Output"]] = DGEList(counts=mat_out, group = rep("Output", ncol(mat_out)))
        lst_edger = lst

        ### filter counts using filterByExpr from edgeR
        dge = lst_edger[["Total"]]
        idx = filterByExpr(dge)

        ### Check: index matched when filtering
        x = names(idx)
        y = row.names(mat_tot)
        if (!all(x == y)) {stop("Error index")}

        ### if passed: filter matrix
        mat_cnt = mat_tot[idx,]

        ### show progress:
        txt_fpath  = txt_fpath_inp
        txt_fname  = basename(txt_fpath)
        txt_prefix = fun_get_prefix(txt_fname)
        
        cat("\n====================\n")
        cat("Region:", txt_region, "\n")
        cat("Assay: ", TXT_ASSAY,  "\n")
        cat("Prefix:", txt_prefix, "\n")
        cat("FPath: ", txt_fpath,  "\n")
        cat("FName: ", txt_fname,  "\n")
        cat("Import Counts:\n")
        cat("#Rows (Before filter):", nrow(dat_cnt), "\n")
        cat("#Rows (After  filter):", nrow(mat_cnt), "\n")
        cat("\n")
        flush.console()

        ### create dds object
        cat("Apply DESeq2: ~Group", "\n")
        dds = DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(
            countData = mat_cnt, 
            colData   = dat_col, 
            design    = ~Group)
        
        ### ensure Input group is set as reference
        dds$Group <- relevel(dds$Group, ref = "Input")

        ### run deseq analysis
        dds = DESeq(dds)

        ### save deseq object
        txt_fdiry = dirname(txt_fpath_inp)
        txt_fname = paste("data", "deseq2", txt_prefix, "rds", sep=".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        
        obj = dds
        saveRDS(obj, txt_fpath)

        ### save DGEList object
        txt_fdiry = dirname(txt_fpath_inp)
        txt_fname = paste("data", "edger", txt_prefix, "rds", sep=".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        
        obj = lst_edger
        saveRDS(obj, txt_fpath)
    }
}

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 32
text:
Execute
Helper function


Code
get_fpkm = function(mat, vec_num_length){
    ### normlaized by size
    fun = function(x){x * 10^6 / sum(x)}
    mat = apply(mat, 2, fun)
    
    ### normlaized by length
    vec = vec_num_length
    fun = function(x){x/vec}
    mat = apply(mat, 2, fun)

    return(mat)
}

get_tpm  = function(mat, vec_num_length){
    ### normlaized by length
    vec = vec_num_length
    fun = function(x){x/vec}
    mat = apply(mat, 2, fun)
    
    ### normlaized by size
    fun = function(x){x * 10^6 / sum(x)}
    mat = apply(mat, 2, fun)
    
    return(mat)
}


Generate matrix of normalized scores


Code
### init
txt_assay = TXT_ASSAY

### excute
for (txt_region in VEC_TXT_REGION) {
    
    ### init 
    lst_dat_screen     = list()
    lst_dat_dds_result = list()
    lst_dat_summary    = list()
    
    for (txt_prefix in VEC_TXT_PREFIX){

        ### ========================================
        ### Import data
        ### ----------------------------------------
        
        ### show progress
        cat("Assay: ", txt_assay,  "\n")
        cat("Prefix:", txt_prefix, "\n")
        cat("Region:", txt_region, "\n")
        cat("\n")
        flush.console()

        ### set file directory
        txt_fdiry = file.path(
            FD_RES, 
            "region_coverage_fcc_score",
            txt_region,
            txt_assay, 
            "summary"
        )
                
        ### get matrix (raw count) and column data
        txt_fname = paste("data.count_column.raw", txt_prefix, "rds", sep = ".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

        lst_dat = readRDS(txt_fpath)
        dat_cnt = lst_dat$data_cnt
        dat_col = lst_dat$data_col
        dat_region = dat_cnt %>% dplyr::select(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Region)
        
        ### get DESeq2 object
        txt_fname = paste("data.deseq2", txt_prefix, "rds", sep = ".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

        dds = readRDS(txt_fpath)
        
        ### get EdgeR object
        txt_fname = paste("data.edger", txt_prefix, "rds", sep = ".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

        lst_dge = readRDS(txt_fpath)

        ### ========================================
        ### Calculate: Screened
        ### ----------------------------------------

        ### apply EdgeR filtering
        lst = lst_dge
        lst = lapply(lst, function(dge){
            idx = filterByExpr(dge)
            dat = data.frame(
                Region = names(idx),
                Screen = idx
            )
            return(dat)
        })

        ### summarize which regions are screened
        dat = bind_rows(lst, .id = "Set")
        dat = dat %>% tidyr::spread(Set, Screen)
        dat = dplyr::inner_join(dat_region, dat, by = "Region")
        
        dat_screen = dat
        
        ### ========================================
        ### Calculate DESeq2 Counts & Log2FC
        ### ----------------------------------------

        ### DESeq2 normalized counts
        mat = counts(dds, normalized=TRUE)
        dat = mat %>% as.data.frame %>% rownames_to_column("Region")
        dat = dplyr::inner_join(dat_region, dat, by = "Region")

        mat_dds_count = mat
        dat_dds_count = dat

        ### Deseq2 results
        res = results(dds, contrast = c("Group", "Output", "Input"))
        dat = res %>% as.data.frame %>% rownames_to_column("Region")
        dat = dplyr::inner_join(dat_region, dat, by = "Region")
        
        dat_dds_result = dat
        
        ### ========================================
        ### Calculate TPM & FPKM
        ### ----------------------------------------

        ### init and get region length
        dat = dat_cnt
        dat = dat %>% dplyr::mutate(Length = ChromEnd - ChromStart)

        ### arrange count into matrix
        mat = dat %>% 
           dplyr::select(
               Region, 
               starts_with("Input"), 
               starts_with("Output")) %>% 
           column_to_rownames(var = "Region")
        
        ### calculate TPM and FPKM
        mat_tpm  = get_tpm(mat, dat$Length)
        mat_fpkm = get_fpkm(mat, dat$Length)
        
        ### arrange matrix into dataframe
        mat = mat_tpm
        dat = mat %>% as.data.frame %>% rownames_to_column("Region")
        dat = dplyr::inner_join(dat_region, dat, by = "Region")
        
        dat_tpm = dat
        
        mat = mat_fpkm
        dat = mat %>% as.data.frame %>% rownames_to_column("Region")
        dat = dplyr::inner_join(dat_region, dat, by = "Region")
        
        dat_fpkm = dat
        
        ### ========================================
        ### Calculate mean TPM & FPKM
        ### ----------------------------------------
        
        ### convert to tidy data
        lst = list(
            "TPM"   = mat_tpm,
            "FPKM"  = mat_fpkm,
            "DESeq" = mat_dds_count
        )
        lst = lapply(lst, function(mat){
            dat = mat %>% 
                as.data.frame %>% 
                rownames_to_column(var = "Region") %>% 
                tidyr::gather(Sample, Value, -Region)
            return(dat)
        })
        dat = bind_rows(lst, .id = "Method")
        
        ### calculate mean by group (Input & Output)
        tmp = dat_col %>% dplyr::select(Sample, Group)
        dat = dplyr::left_join(dat, tmp, by="Sample")
        dat = dat %>%
            dplyr::group_by(Region, Method, Group) %>%
            dplyr::summarize(Mean = mean(Value), .groups = "drop") %>%
            dplyr::mutate(Name = paste(Group, Method, sep = "_")) %>%
            dplyr::select(Region, Name, Mean) %>%
            tidyr::spread(Name, Mean)
        
        dat = dplyr::inner_join(dat_region, dat, by = "Region")
        dat_summary = dat

        ### ========================================
        ### Save results
        ### ----------------------------------------

        ### collect
        lst_dat_screen[[txt_prefix]]     = dat_screen
        lst_dat_dds_result[[txt_prefix]] = dat_dds_result
        lst_dat_summary[[txt_prefix]]    = dat_summary
        
        #txt_fname = "matrix.count.TPM.WGS.tsv"
        txt_fname = paste("matrix.count.TPM", txt_prefix, "tsv", sep = ".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        dat = dat_tpm
        write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
        
        #txt_fname = "matrix.count.FPKM.WGS.tsv"
        txt_fname = paste("matrix.count.FPKM", txt_prefix, "tsv", sep = ".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        dat = dat_fpkm
        write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
        
        #txt_fname = "matrix.count.deseq.WGS.tsv"
        txt_fname = paste("matrix.count.deseq", txt_prefix, "tsv", sep = ".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        dat = dat_dds_count
        write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
        
        #txt_fname = "result.coverage.Log2FC.deseq.tsv"
        txt_fname = paste("region.coverage.Log2FC.deseq", txt_prefix, "tsv", sep = ".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        dat = dat_dds_result
        write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
        
        #txt_fname = "result.coverage.TPM.FPKM.tsv"
        txt_fname = paste("region.coverage.summary", txt_prefix, "tsv", sep = ".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        dat = dat_summary
        write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
        
        #txt_fname = "result.coverage.screened.tsv"
        txt_fname = paste("region.coverage.screened", txt_prefix, "tsv", sep = ".")
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
        dat = dat_screen
        write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
    }
    
    ### concatenate batches
    lst = lst_dat_screen
    dat = bind_rows(lst, .id = "Batch")
    dat_screen_merge = dat
    
    lst = lst_dat_dds_result
    dat = bind_rows(lst, .id = "Batch")
    dat_dds_result_merge = dat
    
    lst = lst_dat_summary
    dat = bind_rows(lst, .id = "Batch")
    dat_summary_merge = dat
    
    #txt_fname = "result.coverage.Log2FC.deseq.tsv"
    txt_fname = paste("region.coverage.Log2FC.deseq", "tsv", sep = ".")
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    dat = dat_dds_result_merge
    write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
    
    #txt_fname = "result.coverage.TPM.FPKM.tsv"
    txt_fname = paste("region.coverage.summary", "tsv", sep = ".")
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    dat = dat_summary_merge
    write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
    
    #txt_fname = "result.coverage.screened.tsv"
    txt_fname = paste("region.coverage.screened", "tsv", sep = ".")
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    dat = dat_screen_merge
    write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
}

Import data


Code
lst = lapply(VEC_TXT_REGION, function(txt_region){
    
    ### show progress:
    cat("====================\n")
    cat("Region Folder:", txt_region, "\n")
    cat("Assay  Folder:", TXT_ASSAY,  "\n")
    cat("Import Files:\n")
    cat(TXT_FNAME_INP, "\n")
    cat("\n")
    flush.console()
    
    ### set directory and import assay description
    txt_fdiry = file.path(FD_RES, "assay_fcc", TXT_ASSAY, "coverage", "summary")
    txt_fname = "description.tsv"
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

    dat_cname_assay = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)

    ### set directory and import region description
    txt_folder = lst_txt_folder[[txt_region]]
    txt_fdiry  = file.path(FD_RES, "region", txt_folder, "summary")
    txt_fname  = "description.tsv"
    txt_fpath  = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    
    dat_cname_region = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)

    ### set column names/types for overlap score
    vec_txt_cname = c(
        paste(dat_cname_region$Name, "A", sep = "_"), 
        paste(dat_cname_assay$Name,  "B", sep = "_"), 
        "Overlap"
    )

    ### set directory and import region-assay overlap
    txt_fdiry  = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region, TXT_ASSAY)
    txt_fname  = TXT_FNAME_INP
    txt_fpath  = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

    ### read table
    dat = read_tsv(txt_fpath, col_names = vec_txt_cname, show_col_types = FALSE)
    return(dat)
})

lst = lst_dat_region_score_arrange
lst = lapply(lst, function(dat){
    ### summarize scores for each region
    dat = dat %>% 
        dplyr::group_by(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Region) %>%
        dplyr::summarise(
            Mean    = mean(Score),
            Median  = median(Score),
            AbsMax  = fun_get_absmax(Score),
            Max     = max(Score),
            Min     = min(Score),
            Count   = n(),
            .groups = "drop"
        )
    return(dat)
})

text:
Save results


Code
for (txt_region in VEC_TXT_REGION){
    ### show progress:
    cat("====================\n")
    cat("Region Folder:", txt_region, "\n")
    cat("Assay  Folder:", TXT_ASSAY,  "\n")
    cat("\n")
    flush.console()
    
    ### get tables
    dat_region_score_summary = lst_dat_region_score_summary[[txt_region]]
    
    ### set directory to save results
    txt_fdiry = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region, TXT_ASSAY, "summary")
    txt_fname = TXT_FNAME_OUT
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    
    ### write region coverage summary
    dir.create(txt_fdiry, showWarnings = FALSE)
    dat = dat_region_score_summary
    dat = dat %>% dplyr::arrange(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd)
    write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)

    ### show progress
    cat("Save file", "\n")
    cat(txt_fdiry, "\n")
    cat(txt_fname, "\n")
    cat("\n")
}

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 35
text:
Summarize scores by target


Code
lst = lst_dat_region_score_arrange
lst = lapply(lst, function(dat){
    ### summarize scores by each target
    dat_summary_total = dat %>%
        dplyr::group_by(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Region, Target) %>%
        dplyr::summarise(
            Mean    = mean(Score),
            Median  = median(Score),
            Max     = max(Score),
            Min     = min(Score),
            Count   = n(),
            .groups = "drop"
        )
    
    ### summarize scores by sign (direction)
    dat_summary_sign = dat %>%
        dplyr::group_by(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Region, Target, Sign) %>%
        dplyr::summarise(Mean = mean(Score), .groups = "drop") %>% 
        dplyr::mutate(Sign = dplyr::recode(Sign, `pos` = "Mean_Pos", `neg` = "Mean_Neg")) %>% 
        tidyr::spread(Sign, Mean)
    
    ### merge the results
    vec = c("Chrom", "ChromStart", "ChromEnd", "Region", "Target")
    dat = dplyr::left_join(
        dat_summary_total,
        dat_summary_sign,
        by = vec) %>% 
        replace(is.na(.), 0)
    return(dat)
})

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 35
section: Futher summarize scores across different targets
text:
Futher summarize scores across different targets


Code
lst = lst_dat_region_score_by_target
lst = lapply(lst, function(dat){
    ### summarize mean(scores) across different targets
    dat = dat %>% 
        dplyr::group_by(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Region) %>%
        dplyr::summarize(
            Mean_Tot = mean(Mean),
            Mean_Pos = max(Mean, 0),
            Mean_Neg = min(Mean, 0),
            Count    = sum(Count),
            Note     = paste(Target, Count, sep=":", collapse="|"),
            .groups  = "drop"
        ) %>%
        dplyr::rename("Mean" = "Mean_Tot")
    return(dat)
})

### assign and show

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 35
text:
Save results


Code
for (txt_region in VEC_TXT_REGION){
    ### show progress:
    cat("====================\n")
    cat("Region Folder:", txt_region, "\n")
    cat("Assay  Folder:", TXT_ASSAY,  "\n")
    cat("\n")
    flush.console()
    
    ### get tables
    dat_region_score_by_target = lst_dat_region_score_by_target[[txt_region]]
    dat_region_score_merge     = lst_dat_region_score_merge[[txt_region]]
    
    ### set file directory
    txt_fdiry  = file.path(
        FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", 
        txt_region, 
        TXT_ASSAY,
        "summary"
    )
    dir.create(txt_fdiry, showWarnings = FALSE)
    
    
    ### write table (summarized by target)
    txt_fname = TXT_FNAME_OUT_TARGET
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

    dat = dat_region_score_by_target
    dat = dat %>% dplyr::arrange(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd)
    write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)

    ### show progress
    cat("Save file", "\n")
    cat(txt_fdiry, "\n")
    cat(txt_fname, "\n")
    cat("\n")
    
    ### write table (further summarized across target)
    txt_fname = TXT_FNAME_OUT_MERGE
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

    dat = dat_region_score_merge
    dat = dat %>% dplyr::arrange(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd)
    write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)
    
    ### show progress
    cat("Save file", "\n")
    cat(txt_fdiry, "\n")
    cat(txt_fname, "\n")
    cat("\n")
}

fun1 = function(txt){
    vec1 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_FOLDER

    res  = fun_str_map_detect(txt, vec1, vec2)

}

fun2 = function(txt){
    vec1 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_FOLDER
    vec2 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_GROUP
    res  = fun_str_map_detect(txt, vec1, vec2)

}

fun3 = function(txt){

    vec2 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_LABEL

}

lst = lapply(VEC_TXT_REGION, function(txt_region){
    ### set file glob
    txt_fdiry  = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region)
    txt_fname  = "region.coverage.Log2FC.deseq.tsv"
    txt_fglob  = file.path(txt_fdiry, "*", "summary", txt_fname)

    ### get file paths
    vec = Sys.glob(txt_fglob)
    vec_txt_fpath = vec

    ### import tables
    lst = lapply(vec_txt_fpath, function(txt_fpath){
        dat = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
        dat = dat %>% dplyr::mutate(
            Assay_Folder = fun1(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Group  = fun2(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Label  = fun3(txt_fpath)
        )
        return(dat)
    }) 

    ### combine tables
    dat = bind_rows(lst)
    return(dat)
})

Summarize FCC effect sizes

lst = lst_dat_region_score_deseq_import
lst = lapply(lst, function(dat){
    ### process scores
    dat = dat %>% 
        dplyr::group_by(Assay_Group) %>%
        dplyr::mutate(
            Score = log2FoldChange,
            Zcore = as.vector(scale(log2FoldChange)),
            Score_Label = "Log2FC",
            Zcore_Label = "Scale(Log2FC)"
        ) %>%
        dplyr::ungroup()

    ### arrange results
    dat = dat %>%
        dplyr::select(
            Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Region, 
            Score, 
            Zcore,
            Score_Label,
            Zcore_Label,
            Assay_Folder,  
            Assay_Group,
            Assay_Label
        ) %>%
        dplyr::arrange(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd)
    return(dat)
})

lst = lapply(VEC_TXT_REGION, function(txt_region){
    ### loop through each assay and import table
    lst = lapply(vec_txt_assay, function(txt_assay){
        ### set file glob
        txt_fdiry  = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region, txt_assay, "summary")
        txt_fname = vec_txt_fname[txt_assay]
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

        ### import table
        dat = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
        dat = dat %>% dplyr::mutate(
            Assay_Folder = fun1(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Group  = fun2(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Label  = fun3(txt_fpath)
        )
        return(dat)
    }) 

    ### combine tables
    dat = bind_rows(lst)
    return(dat)
})

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 41
text:
Process LMPRA
Prepare assay and file names


Code
vec_txt_assay = c(
    "MPRA_Lenti_K562_Nadav_Vikram"
)
vec = c(
    "region.coverage.score.log2fc.tsv"
)
names(vec) = vec_txt_assay
vec_txt_fname = vec


Check input files


Code
txt_region = VEC_TXT_REGION[1]
txt_assay  = vec_txt_assay[1]
txt_fdiry  = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region)
txt_fname  = "region.coverage.score.*.tsv"
txt_fglob  = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_assay, "summary", txt_fname)

vec = Sys.glob(txt_fglob)
for (txt in vec) {cat(txt, "\n")}


/data/reddylab/Kuei/repo/Proj_ENCODE_FCC/results/region_coverage_fcc_score/fcc_astarr_macs_input_overlap/MPRA_Lenti_K562_Nadav_Vikram/summary/region.coverage.score.log2fc.tsv 
/data/reddylab/Kuei/repo/Proj_ENCODE_FCC/results/region_coverage_fcc_score/fcc_astarr_macs_input_overlap/MPRA_Lenti_K562_Nadav_Vikram/summary/region.coverage.score.zscore.tsv 



Import data


Code
lst = lapply(VEC_TXT_REGION, function(txt_region){
    ### loop through each assay and import table
    lst = lapply(vec_txt_assay, function(txt_assay){
        ### set file glob
        txt_fdiry  = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region, txt_assay, "summary")
        txt_fname = vec_txt_fname[txt_assay]
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

        ### import table
        dat = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
        dat = dat %>% dplyr::mutate(
            Assay_Folder = fun1(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Group  = fun2(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Label  = fun3(txt_fpath)
        )
        return(dat)
    }) 

    ### combine tables
    dat = bind_rows(lst)
    return(dat)
})

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 41
text:
Save results


Code
for (txt_region in VEC_TXT_REGION){
    ### get tables
    dat_region_score_total = lst_dat_region_score_total[[txt_region]]
    dat_region_score_final = lst_dat_region_score_final[[txt_region]]
    
    ### set file directory
    txt_fdiry  = file.path(
        FD_RES, 
        "region_coverage_fcc_score", 
        txt_region, 
        "summary"
    )
    dir.create(txt_fdiry, showWarnings = FALSE)
    txt_cmd = paste("mkdir -p", txt_fdiry)
    system(txt_cmd)
    
    ### save table with all FCC assays
    txt_fname = "region.coverage.score.fcc.total.tsv"
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    dat = dat_region_score_total
    write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)

    ### show progress
    cat("Save file", "\n")
    cat(txt_fdiry, "\n")
    cat(txt_fname, "\n")
    cat("\n")
    
    ### save table with selected FCC assays
    txt_fname = "region.coverage.score.fcc.final.tsv"
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    dat = dat_region_score_final
    write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)

    ### show progress
    cat("Save file", "\n")
    cat(txt_fdiry, "\n")
    cat(txt_fname, "\n")
    cat("\n")
}

Helper functions
Setup assay name, type, and group matching


Code
VEC_TXT_ASSAY_FOLDER = c(
    "CRISPRi_FlowFISH_K562_Riley_JinWoo",
    "CRISPRi_Growth_K562_Gersbach_JinWoo", 
    "MPRA_Lenti_K562_Nadav_Vikram", 
    "MPRA_Tiling_K562_Tewhey_Hannah", 
    "STARR_ATAC_K562_Reddy_KS274", 
    "STARR_ATAC_K562_Reddy_KS91", 
    "STARR_ATAC_K562_Reddy_KSMerge", 
    "STARR_WHG_K562_Reddy_A001"
)

VEC_TXT_ASSAY_GROUP = c(
    "CRISPRi-HCRFF",
    "CRISPRi-Growth",
    "LMPRA",
    "TMPRA",
    "ASTARR_KS274",
    "ASTARR_KS91",
    "ASTARR_KSMerge",
    "WSTARR"
)

VEC_TXT_ASSAY_LABEL = c(
    "CRISPRi-HCRFF",
    "CRISPRi-Growth",
    "LMPRA",
    "TMPRA",
    "ASTARR",
    "ASTARR",
    "ASTARR",
    "WSTARR"
)

fun1 = function(txt){
    vec1 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_FOLDER
    vec2 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_FOLDER
    res  = fun_str_map_detect(txt, vec1, vec2)
    return(res)
}

fun2 = function(txt){
    vec1 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_FOLDER
    vec2 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_GROUP
    res  = fun_str_map_detect(txt, vec1, vec2)
    return(res)
}

fun3 = function(txt){
    vec1 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_FOLDER
    vec2 = VEC_TXT_ASSAY_LABEL
    res  = fun_str_map_detect(txt, vec1, vec2)
    return(res)
}

Import data


Code
lst = lapply(VEC_TXT_REGION, function(txt_region){
    ### set file glob
    txt_fdiry  = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region)
    txt_fname  = "region.coverage.Log2FC.deseq.tsv"
    txt_fglob  = file.path(txt_fdiry, "*", "summary", txt_fname)

    ### get file paths
    vec = Sys.glob(txt_fglob)
    vec_txt_fpath = vec

    ### import tables
    lst = lapply(vec_txt_fpath, function(txt_fpath){
        dat = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
        dat = dat %>% dplyr::mutate(
            Assay_Folder = fun1(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Group  = fun2(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Label  = fun3(txt_fpath)
        )
        return(dat)
    }) 

    ### combine tables
    dat = bind_rows(lst)
    return(dat)
})  

### assign and label

res = lapply(lst, dim)
print(res)

lst = lst_dat_region_score_deseq_import
lst = lapply(lst, function(dat){
    ### process scores
    dat = dat %>% 
        dplyr::group_by(Assay_Group) %>%
        dplyr::mutate(
            Score = log2FoldChange,

        dplyr::select(
            Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Region,

            Zcore,

            Zcore_Label,
            Assay_Folder,  
            Assay_Group,
            Assay_Label
        ) %>%
        dplyr::arrange(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd)
    return(dat)
})

lst = lapply(VEC_TXT_REGION, function(txt_region){
    ### loop through each assay and import table
    lst = lapply(vec_txt_assay, function(txt_assay){
        ### set file glob
        txt_fdiry  = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region, txt_assay, "summary")
        txt_fname = vec_txt_fname[txt_assay]
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

        ### import table
        dat = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
        dat = dat %>% dplyr::mutate(
            Assay_Folder = fun1(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Group  = fun2(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Label  = fun3(txt_fpath)
        )
        return(dat)
    }) 

    ### combine tables
    dat = bind_rows(lst)
    return(dat)
})

Import data


Code
lst = lapply(VEC_TXT_REGION, function(txt_region){
    ### loop through each assay and import table
    lst = lapply(vec_txt_assay, function(txt_assay){
        ### set file glob
        txt_fdiry  = file.path(FD_RES, "region_coverage_fcc_score", txt_region, txt_assay, "summary")
        txt_fname = vec_txt_fname[txt_assay]
        txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)

        ### import table
        dat = read_tsv(txt_fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)
        dat = dat %>% dplyr::mutate(
            Assay_Folder = fun1(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Group  = fun2(txt_fpath),
            Assay_Label  = fun3(txt_fpath)
        )
        return(dat)
    }) 

    ### combine tables
    dat = bind_rows(lst)
    return(dat)
})

Summarize FCC effect sizes


Code
lst = lst_dat_region_score_lmpra_import
lst = lapply(lst, function(dat){
    ### process scores
    dat = dat %>% 
        dplyr::group_by(Assay_Group) %>%
        dplyr::mutate(
            Score = Mean,
            Zcore = as.vector(scale(Mean)),
            Score_Label = "Log2FC scaled by Neg.Ctrl",
            Zcore_Label = "Scale(Log2FC)"
        ) %>%
        dplyr::ungroup()

    ### arrange results
    dat = dat %>% 
        dplyr::select(
            Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd, Region, 
            Score, 
            Zcore,
            Score_Label,
            Zcore_Label,
            Assay_Folder,
            Assay_Group,
            Assay_Label
        ) %>%
        dplyr::arrange(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd)
    return(dat)
})

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 43
text:
Save results


Code
for (txt_region in VEC_TXT_REGION){
    ### get table
    dat_region_score_final = lst_dat_region_score_final[[txt_region]]
    
    ### set file directory
    txt_fdiry  = file.path(
        FD_RES, 
        "region_coverage_fcc_score", 
        txt_region, 
        "summary"
    )
    #dir.create(txt_fdiry, showWarnings = FALSE)
    #txt_cmd = paste("mkdir -p", txt_fdiry)
    #system(txt_cmd)
    
    ### save table with selected FCC assays
    txt_fname = "region.coverage.score.fcc.test.tsv"
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    dat = dat_region_score_final
    write_tsv(dat, txt_fpath)

    ### show progress
    cat("Save file", "\n")
    cat(txt_fdiry, "\n")
    cat(txt_fname, "\n")
    cat("\n")
}

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 55
text:
Prepare table for heatmap plot


Code
vec_txt_gene = c(
    "NMU",
    "MEF2C",
    "CD164",
    "MYB", "HBS1L", "HBG1", "HBG2", "HBE1",
    "PVT1", "MYC",
    "LMO2", "CAPRIN1", "CAT",
    "FADS1", "FADS2", "FADS3", "FEN1",
    "ERP29",
    "GATA1", "HDAC6"
)

vec_txt_chrom = paste0("chr", c(1:22, "X", "Y"))




Code
lst = lst_dat_region_score_arrange
lol = lapply(lst, function(dat){
    ### get score and target column; long -> wide
    dat = dat %>% 
        dplyr::select(Chrom:Region, Target, Mean) %>%
        tidyr::spread(Target, Mean) %>%
        dplyr::select(Chrom:Region, all_of(vec_txt_gene))
    
    ### arrange regions (rows)
    dat = dat %>% 
        dplyr::mutate(Chrom = factor(Chrom, levels=vec_txt_chrom)) %>%
        dplyr::arrange(Chrom, ChromStart, ChromEnd)
                      
    ### split into score matrix and annotatoin
    dat_region_annot = dat %>% 
        dplyr::select(Region, Chrom) %>% 
        column_to_rownames(var = "Region")
    dat_region_score = dat %>% 
        dplyr::select(-Chrom, -ChromStart, -ChromEnd) %>% 
        column_to_rownames(var = "Region")

    ### combine the results
    lst = list(
        "Score" = dat_region_score,
        "Annot" = dat_region_annot
    )
    return(lst)
})

### assign and show
lol_dat_region_score_result = lol

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 55
text:
Explore: Screened regions of CRISPRi-HCRFF


Code
### set range
paletteLength = 50
#mat  = dat_score
bmin = -2.5
bmax =  6
xmin = -2 # min(mat)
xmax =  2 # max(mat)
nmin = ceiling((paletteLength-1)/2)
nmax = floor(  (paletteLength-1)/2)

### set color
myColor = c(
    "blue",
    colorRampPalette(c("blue", "white"))(nmin),
    "white",
    colorRampPalette(c("white", "red"))(nmax),
    "red"
)

### set breaks
myBreaks = c(
    bmin,
    seq(xmin, xmin/paletteLength, length.out=nmin),
    0,
    seq(xmax/paletteLength, xmax, length.out=nmax),
    bmax
)




Code
options(repr.plot.height=10, repr.plot.width=8)
idx = "Total"
lol = lol_dat_region_score_result 
lst = lol[[idx]]

dat_region_score = lst[["Score"]]
dat_region_annot = lst[["Annot"]]

### generate plots
plt = pheatmap(
    dat_region_score,
    cluster_row  = FALSE,
    cluster_cols = FALSE,
    show_rownames = FALSE,
    annotation_names_row = FALSE,
    annotation_row = dat_region_annot,
    color=myColor, 
    breaks=myBreaks
)

### assign and show
plt_heatmap_crispri_hcrff_total = plt
options(repr.plot.height=10, repr.plot.width=8)
print(plt)

title: Region Coverage (FCC) 61
section: Explore: Correlations across input and output
text:
Explore: Correlations across input and output


Code
### set plot style
theme_text = THEME_TEXT

### generate plot
lst = lst_dat_region_score_summary_import
lst = lapply(lst, function(dat){
    gpt = ggplot(dat, aes(x=.data[["Input_TPM"]] + 1, y=.data[["Output_TPM"]] + 1)) + 
        geom_hex(bins=100) +
        scale_fill_viridis_c() +
        theme_cowplot() +
        background_grid() +
        scale_x_log10(
            breaks = c( 1,  10^0.5, 10,  10^1.5,  100),
            labels = c("1", "",    "10", "",     "100")
        ) +
        scale_y_log10(
            breaks = c( 1,  10^0.5, 10,  10^1.5,  100),
            labels = c("1", "",    "10", "",     "100")
        ) +
        labs(
            x     = "Log10(Input TPM + 1)",
            y     = "Log10(Output TPM + 1)",
            title = TXT_ASSAY_LABEL,
            fill  = "Count"
        ) +
        theme_text
    return(gpt)
})

### assign and show
lst_gpt_scatter_input_vs_output = lst

idx = "fcc_astarr_macs_input_union"
gpt = lst[[idx]]

options(repr.plot.height=6, repr.plot.width=7)
print(gpt)

Get scores


Code

lst = split(dat$Zcore, dat$Assay_Label)

lst_vec_num_score = lst
print(names(lst))


[1] "ASTARR"         "CRISPRi-Growth" "CRISPRi-HCRFF"  "LMPRA"         
[5] "TMPRA"          "WSTARR"        


Generate density plots


Code
lst = lapply(vec_txt_assay, function(txt_assay){
    ### get scores
    vec_num_score = lst_vec_num_score[[txt_assay]]
    dat_num_score = data.frame(Score = vec_num_score)

    ### set plot range
    num_prob = 0.0001
    vec_num_range = quantile(
        vec_num_score, 
        probs = c(num_prob, 1-num_prob)
    )
    
    ### generate plot
    gpt = ggplot(dat_num_score, aes(x=Score)) + 
        geom_histogram(bins = 70) + 
        labs(x="", y="", title=txt_assay) +
        theme_cowplot() +
        xlim(vec_num_range)
})

### assign and show

gpt = lst[[4]]

options(repr.plot.height=3, repr.plot.width=3)
print(gpt)

lst = lst_gpt_hist_assay
for (idx in names(lst)){
    ### get plot
    txt = str_replace_all(idx, "-", "_")
    gpt = lst[[idx]]
    
    ### show progress
    cat(idx, "\n")
    cat(txt, "\n")
    cat("\n")

    ### save plot
    txt_fdiry = "."
    txt_fname = paste0("fig.region_coverage_fcc.histogram.zscore.", txt, ".png")
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    
    suppressWarnings(ggsave(txt_fpath, gpt, height = 3, width = 3, units = "in"))
}

    dat,

    scale = FALSE,       # If TRUE, scales the correlation text font
    density = FALSE,     # If TRUE, adds density plots and histograms
    ellipses = FALSE,    # If TRUE, draws ellipses
    method = "spearman", # Correlation method (also "spearman" or "kendall")

    factor = 2,          # Jittering factor
    hist.col = "grey30", # Histograms color
    stars = TRUE,        # If TRUE, adds significance level with stars
    ci = FALSE,          # If TRUE, adds confidence intervals
    # text‐size controls specific to pairs.panels():

    cex.cor    = 1.5     # correlation text
)

Loop through each pair and generate plot


Code
lst = lapply(dat_assay_comb2, function(idxs){
    ### get index
    txt_assay1 = idxs[1]
    txt_assay2 = idxs[2]

    ### set axis range
    num_prob       = 0.0001
    vec_num_prob   = c(num_prob, 1-num_prob)
    vec_num_score1 = dat_region_score_arrange[[txt_assay1]]
    vec_num_score2 = dat_region_score_arrange[[txt_assay2]]
    vec_num_range1 = quantile(vec_num_score1, probs = vec_num_prob, na.rm = "TRUE")
    vec_num_range2 = quantile(vec_num_score2, probs = vec_num_prob, na.rm = "TRUE")

    ### get scores in regions overlapped
    dat = dat_region_score_arrange
    dat = dat %>% dplyr::select({{idxs}}) %>% na.omit

    ### set title
    num  = nrow(dat)
    txt1 = paste0(txt_assay1, ":", txt_assay2)
    txt2 = paste0("(", "#Region=", scales::comma(num), ")")
    txt_title = paste(txt1, "\n", txt2)
    
    ### generate plot
    gpt = ggplot(dat, aes(x=.data[[txt_assay1]], y=.data[[txt_assay2]])) + 
        geom_hex(bins=60) +
        scale_fill_viridis_c() +
        theme_cowplot() +
        xlim(vec_num_range1) +
        ylim(vec_num_range2) +
        labs(title = txt_title)
    return(gpt)
})

text:
Export results
Save plot grid


Code
plt_export = plt_scatter_pair_grid
txt_export = "fig.region_coverage_fcc.scatter_hex.zscore.grid"

txt_fdiry = "./"
txt_fname = paste(txt_export, "png", sep = ".")
txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
ggsave(txt_fpath, plt_export, height = 5.1*3, width = 5*5, units = "in")

txt_fdiry = "./"
txt_fname = paste(txt_export, "svg", sep = ".")
txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
ggsave(txt_fpath, plt_export, height = 5.1*3, width = 5*5, units = "in")


Save each scatter plot


Code
options(repr.plot.height=5, repr.plot.width=5)
lst = lst_gpt_scatter_pair
for (txt in names(lst)){
    ### show progress
    gpt = lst[[txt]]
    gpt = gpt + 
        theme(plot.title = element_blank()) +
        theme(legend.position = "None")
    suppressWarnings(print(gpt))

    ### save plot
    txt_fdiry = "."
    #txt_fname = paste0("fig_hex_pair_", txt, ".png")
    txt_fname = paste0("fig.region_coverage_fcc.scatter_hex.zscore.", txt, ".png")
    txt_fpath = file.path(txt_fdiry, txt_fname)
    
    gpt = gpt + labs(x="", y="")
    suppressWarnings(ggsave(txt_fpath, gpt, width = 3, height = 3))
}
